ARCHIVIST 
Statement ends. 
Hmm. Better. Does reading a statement of the Ceaseless Watcher count as a 
sort of auto-cannibalism, I wonder? Or some sort of bird-like regurgitation of 
fear, re-consuming second-hand terror? Whatever the analogy, I’m finding it 
harder and harder to ignore the diminishing returns, how much less

satisfaction each one gives me. My desire for follow-up, for verification, for 
proper digestion of the experience, it grows less and less. I honestly don’t care 
if Mr Maraj was chased down and consumed by his voyeuristic former friend, 
or if he has forgotten the whole affair, living in blissful ignorance. I just find my 
mind already wandering to the next statement, and the hopes that it won’t be 
quite as stale. 
End recording.
